description: Unique identifier for the accident record.
System timestamp for when the accident record was created or last updated; includes milliseconds. Confirm whether it reflects event time or record activity.
Local time of the incident (HHMMSS).
Indicates the incident involved a hit-and-run.
Flags that the case/claim processing is complete.
Date of the incident (YYYYMMDD).
Primary street, highway, or location where the incident occurred.
City or municipality of the incident location.
County or jurisdiction of the incident location; entries may include city names due to data entry.
Short description of the incident and damage.
Insurance claim reference or internal claim identifier for this incident.
Free-text narrative describing circumstances, damage, and outcomes.
Total actual costs paid or incurred for the incident to date; confirm currency and rollup.
Overall total for the claim, typically the estimated or approved amount; confirm definition and currency.
Estimated cost for the incident (overall or company equipment); confirm scope.
Estimated third-party property damage costs; confirm scope.
Actual third-party property damage costs paid; confirm scope.
Actual costs for other/third-party equipment; likely non-company assets; confirm.
Estimated costs for other/third-party equipment; likely non-company assets; confirm.
Total costs related to company-owned equipment (actual or aggregated); confirm whether this is actual or estimate.
Number of people injured in the incident.
Count of fleet vehicles/equipment involved or affected.
Coded accident type/category identifier.
Lookup set name used to decode the accident type code.
Day of week on which the incident occurred.
Binary image attachment (evidence photo) of the incident.
Original unique key from the legacy source system (if imported).
Legacy source table name from which this record was migrated.
Additional location detail, such as a cross street or second address line.
Postal/ZIP code for the incident location.
Coded state or province of the incident location; references a lookup.
Lookup set name used to decode the state code.
Organizational hierarchy level code (e.g., cost center or sub-unit) associated with the incident.
Lookup set name used to decode the level-9 hierarchy code.
Organizational hierarchy level code (mid-level unit) associated with the incident.
Lookup set name used to decode the level-2 hierarchy code.
Top-level organizational hierarchy code associated with the incident.
Lookup set name used to decode the level-1 hierarchy code.
